intro: Rubus nutkanus var. bifarius, commonly known as the twin-fruit blackberry, is a species of bramble native to western North America. It is characterized by its biennial growth habit, producing fruit on the previous year’s wood. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
